column5: Maureen Shelleau posts on this board as Lake Ranger, and along with Phil Harrison, does the fishing cartoons for Off the Dock Toons   that we often see here.  Besides the cartoons she is also  extremely talented at drawing animals, especially horses, but she does an incredible job on dog portraits also.  I talked to Maureen awhile back about doing a portrait of my little buddy Marvin. I sent her a favorite photograph of him and she took it from there. I picked it up a couple days ago and thought some of you dog lovers may be interested in seeing it.  The picture is 20" X 25" and is in a portrait shop in Lakefield right now having a custom frame made for it. It'll then hang in the living room.  It looks even better in person than this photograph but you'll get a pretty good idea of the talent involved in doing this.
That is awesome!  I always appreciate artistic talent, probably because, I can barely draw stick people
Fantastic
Ive got some good drawing skills, but thats just OUTRAGEOUS!!! I had to re-read and make sure you didnt say "photograph of my pooch"
that a great portrait  but he's not wearing his toque LOL
Wow...that's impressive.  She might even be good enough to do a drawing of you that looks like you're actually smiling, Lew
Great portrait Lew! Maureen, you have some amazing artistic skills, I'm way impressed.
Dang now that is awesome looking great work and such a talent
I don't think anyones THAT good johnny  Here's your touque Terry and it's still one of my favorite pics of Ole Marv
What a wonderful portrait. Looks like a much younger Marv
That is BEAUTUFUL!
Excellent - That's Marv.
Guess whos next.  Very nice Lew.
What a great portrait Lew  Alot of talent in that right there!!!!
Gosh, that's fantastic!

Gee, thanks everyone for such inspiring comments! I really don't know what to say other than thanks Lew for posting this, I'm really happy to hear there is a likeness and that you're happy with the pooch portrait! Marvin was a fun guy to draw so that always makes the job easier! Sorry about missing out on the touque though, I figured since it's summer he would be fine without it.
What a beautiful portrait of Marvin. something to keep for a lifetime! Maureen, that is some awesome talent you got going there! The life in his eyes is fantastic!
I posted this a while ago, but just to give you another perspective of Maureen's talent.  My beloved Benson who we lost a year and a half ago and his best buddy Chloe.
You have a really great talent. Also I am amazed that you got them to sit still for that long!!
That's just marvelous of Marvin...  Thanks for posting Lew...  I'll be adding it to my "animals" screen saver...
That's pretty life like, very nice job.
Thanks for all the positive replies about the picture folks, I'm really looking forward to getting it back from the framer & hung up in the living room.
Circulating Marvin's portrait might help get him a little action in the neighborhood.  Shouldn't hurt any.
